events.message: Customer reported a car accident involving a collision with another vehicle on Main Street during rush hour.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after review of the reported collision details.
An insurance agent specialized in vehicle claims has been assigned to handle the case.
The insurance company officially acknowledged receipt of the auto accident claim and informed the customer.
Requested police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and insurance card from the claimant for processing.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including accident photos and the official police report.
Investigation into the vehicle collision claim has been initiated by the assigned claims adjuster.
The investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault and damage assessments are complete.
A settlement proposal covering the repair costs and rental car expenses has been sent to the claimant.
The claimant responded positively expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement offer.
The insurance claim was officially approved following the customer's acceptance of the settlement terms.
Payment covering the approved settlement amount was issued directly to the repair service provider.
The auto accident claim was formally closed after successful payment and confirmation from the claimant.
The case files and documentation related to the auto accident claim have been archived for future reference.
